intro: Caucalis anthriscus, commonly known as lesser cow-wheat, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, and its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in disturbed or nutrient-rich soils. Caucalis anthriscus is a biennial or short-lived perennial that produces a capsule fruit containing several seeds.
